hints.title: Hypocoercive LSI for Kinetic Operator
hints.content:
118: :label: thm-kinetic-lsi-standalone
119: 
120: The kinetic operator $\Psi_{\text{kin}}(\tau)$ satisfies:
121: 
122: $$
123: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu' \| \pi_{\text{kin}}) \leq (1 - \alpha_{\text{kin}} \tau) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi_{\text{kin}}) + O(\tau^2)
124: $$
125: 
126: where:
127: $$
128: \alpha_{\text{kin}} = c \cdot \gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}}
129: $$

hints.raw_directive:
115: ### 1.4. Hypocoercivity via Villani's Framework
116: 
117: :::{prf:theorem} Hypocoercive LSI for Kinetic Operator
118: :label: thm-kinetic-lsi-standalone
119: 
120: The kinetic operator $\Psi_{\text{kin}}(\tau)$ satisfies:
121: 
122: $$
123: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu' \| \pi_{\text{kin}}) \leq (1 - \alpha_{\text{kin}} \tau) D_{\text{KL}}(\mu \| \pi_{\text{kin}}) + O(\tau^2)
124: $$
125: 
126: where:
127: $$
128: \alpha_{\text{kin}} = c \cdot \gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}}
129: $$
130: 
131: for some universal constant $c > 0$, with $\kappa_{\text{conf}} := \inf_{x} \lambda_{\min}(\nabla^2 U(x))$ the convexity modulus.

hints.label: unlabeled-proof-61
hints.content:
135: :::{prf:proof}
136: 
137: We use **Villani's hypocoercivity framework** (Villani 2009, "Hypocoercivity").
138: 
139: **Step 1: Modified entropy functional**
140: 
141: Define the modified entropy:
142: 
143: $$
144: \mathcal{H}_\lambda(f) := H(f | \pi_{\text{kin}}) + \lambda \mathcal{I}(f)
145: $$
146: 
147: where $H(f | \pi) = \int f \log(f/\pi)$ is relative entropy and:
148: 
149: $$
150: \mathcal{I}(f) := \int \pi_{\text{kin}}(x, v) \left|\nabla_v \log \frac{f(x, v)}{\pi_{\text{kin}}(x, v)}\right|^2 dxdv
151: $$
152: 
153: is the Fisher information in the velocity variable.
154: 
155: **Step 2: Entropy dissipation**
156: 
157: The time derivative of $\mathcal{H}_\lambda$ along the kinetic flow satisfies:
158: 
159: $$
160: \frac{d}{dt} \mathcal{H}_\lambda \leq -\gamma \mathcal{D}(f) - \lambda \gamma \mathcal{I}(f) + \lambda \|\nabla_x \log f - \nabla_x \log \pi\|_{L^2(\pi)}^2
161: $$
162: 
163: where $\mathcal{D}(f) = \int \pi |\nabla_v \log(f/\pi)|^2$ is the velocity Dirichlet form.
164: 
165: **Step 3: Poincaré inequality for velocity**
166: 
167: Since the velocity distribution is Gaussian, it satisfies a Poincaré inequality:
168: 
169: $$
170: \text{Var}_v[g] \leq \frac{\sigma_v^2}{\gamma} \mathbb{E}_v[|\nabla_v g|^2]
171: $$
172: 
173: Applied to our setting, this gives:
174: 
175: $$
176: \mathcal{I}(f) \geq \frac{\gamma}{\sigma_v^2} \text{Var}_{v|x}[\log f]
177: $$
178: 
179: **Step 4: Coupling via position gradient**
180: 
181: The key hypocoercive estimate is:
182: 
183: $$
184: \|\nabla_x \log f - \nabla_x \log \pi\|_{L^2(\pi)}^2 \leq C \kappa_{\text{conf}}^{-1} H(f | \pi)
185: $$
186: 
187: This holds because log-concavity of $\pi$ (convexity of $U$) controls position fluctuations.
188: 
189: **Step 5: Choose $\lambda$ optimally**
190: 
191: Setting $\lambda = C' / (\gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}})$ for appropriate $C'$, we get:
192: 
193: $$
194: \frac{d}{dt} \mathcal{H}_\lambda \leq -c \gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}} H(f | \pi)
195: $$
196: 
197: for some $c > 0$.
198: 
199: **Step 6: Equivalence of entropies**
200: 
201: Since $\mathcal{I}(f) \geq 0$, we have:
202: 
203: $$
204: H(f | \pi) \leq \mathcal{H}_\lambda(f) \leq H(f | \pi) + \lambda \mathcal{I}_{\max}
205: $$
206: 
207: For bounded $\mathcal{I}$, this gives equivalence, and thus:
208: 
209: $$
210: \frac{d}{dt} H(f | \pi) \leq -c \gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}} H(f | \pi) + \text{correction}
211: $$
212: 
213: **Step 7: Discrete-time bound**
214: 
215: For time step $\tau$, integrating gives:
216: 
217: $$
218: H(\mu' | \pi_{\text{kin}}) \leq e^{-c \gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}} \tau} H(\mu | \pi_{\text{kin}}) \approx (1 - \alpha_{\text{kin}} \tau) H(\mu | \pi_{\text{kin}})
219: $$
220: 
221: where $\alpha_{\text{kin}} = c \gamma \kappa_{\text{conf}}$.
222:
